title: Untitled Goose Game
credit_line:
Gift of House House Pty Ltd.
Acquired via the National videogame collecting partnership between ACMI, the Powerhouse and the National Film and Sound Archive.
material_description: Digital videogame and archive of material relating to the creation of Untitled Goose Game
brief_description: Untitled Goose Game is developed by Australian developer House House. Players take on the role of an annoying goose, waddling around an old English Town to create mischief and chaos. By completing a to-do list, players gradually unlock access to more areas of the town. Untitled Goose Game received widespread acclaim since its launched in late September 2019, with critics praising its gameplay and humour. It was named the D.I.C.E. Game of the Year and received a BAFTA Games Award for Best Family and Social game in 2020. It is available for PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo Switch, PC and Mac.

constellations_other.name: Right on cue
constellations_other.description: In the silent film era, cue sheets charted major moments of a film, along with recommended audio accompaniment matching the action on screen.

description: It’s a lovely morning in the village and you are horrible goose. Untitled Goose Game is a slapstick-stealth-sandbox, where you are a goose let loose on an unsuspecting village. Make your way around town, from peoples’ back gardens to the high street shops to the village green, setting up pranks, stealing hats, honking a lot, and generally ruining everyoneâ€™s day.
